title: Build error in src/librustc_data_structures/profiling.rs
body:
When compiling nightly on OpenBSD, I get this build error:

```
   Compiling rustc-rayon v0.3.0
   Compiling rustc-ap-rustc_data_structures v642.0.0
error[E0605]: non-primitive cast: `std::num::NonZeroU64` as `u32`
   --> /home/ltratt/tmp/build-rust/build_dir/rustc-nightly-src/vendor/rustc-ap-rustc_data_structures/profiling.rs:312:29
    |
312 |             let thread_id = std::thread::current().id().as_u64() as u32;
    |                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: an `as` expression can only be used to convert between primitive types. Consider using the `From` trait

error[E0605]: non-primitive cast: `std::num::NonZeroU64` as `u32`
   --> /home/ltratt/tmp/build-rust/build_dir/rustc-nightly-src/vendor/rustc-ap-rustc_data_structures/profiling.rs:471:25
    |
471 |         let thread_id = std::thread::current().id().as_u64() as u32;
    |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: an `as` expression can only be used to convert between primitive types. Consider using the `From` trait

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```

This seems to be the result of c8140a88f67cf1fea104b1aaa615af7816984615. Naively, this error doesn't seem surprising: `as_u64() as u32` does not look like a chunk of code I'd have expected to compile but perhaps I'm missing out on something obvious!
